metadata.title: CVE-2021-23993 on Ubuntu 20.04 ESM (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
An attacker may perform a DoS attack to prevent a user from sendingencrypted email to a correspondent. If an attacker creates a craftedOpenPGP key with a subkey that has an invalid self signature, and theThunderbird user imports the crafted key, then Thunderbird may try to usethe invalid subkey, but the RNP library rejects it from being used, causingencryption to fail. This vulnerability affects Thunderbird < 78.9.1.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-23993` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

thunderbird - 1:78.11.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.2
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:78.11.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.2
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:78.11.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.2
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:78.11.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.2
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:78.11.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.2
xul-ext-lightning - 1:78.11.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: thunderbird package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:78.11.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.2').
